intro: Psammogeton cabulicus, commonly known as the Afghan sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in sandy and arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water. Psammogeton cabulicus is often found in dry, rocky soils and is considered a characteristic species of steppe and desert ecosystems.
